fs.polyglot.model
Class PolyglotOptions

java.lang.Object
  fs.xml.FsfwConfigurator
      fs.polyglot.model.PolyglotOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLConfigurable
public class PolyglotOptions
extends FsfwConfigurator
implements XMLConfigurable

This class summarizes all options that can be set for the application Polyglot. It can be configured via XML. It also takes care of all fsframework options

Author:
Simon Hampe

Constructor Summary
PolyglotOptions()
          This will construct a PolyglotOptions object with XMLConfigurable ID "polyglotoptions" and a default configuration
PolyglotOptions(java.lang.String xmlID, org.dom4j.Node n)
          This will construct a PolyglotOptions object with the specified string (null will be replaced by the default value "polyglotoptions"), which will be configured by n.

Method Detail

getMaxfilenumber

public int getMaxfilenumber()
Returns:
the maximal number of recently opened files that will be recorded

setMaxfilenumber

public void setMaxfilenumber(int maxfilenumber)
Sets the maximal number of recently opened files that will be recorded. If the parameter is < 0, it will be replaced by 0. If the list of recently opened files is longer than this number, it will be truncated.

getLastfiles

public java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> getLastfiles()
Returns:
A copy of the list of recently opened files.

setLastfiles

public void setLastfiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> lastfiles)
Sets the list of files which have been opened last. The maximal size of this list will be determined by maxfilenumber. If the list size is greater than this number, the list will be truncated to the first maxfilenumber elements.

Parameters:
lastfiles - A list of files. Null will be replaced by the empty list

configure

public void configure(org.dom4j.Node n)
               throws XMLWriteConfigurationException
For every possible option, this will look for the appropriate first-level node (as specified either in FsfwConfigurator.xsd or PolyglotOptions.xsd) and configure the corresponding option. If a node does not exist or contains invalid content, the corresponding option remains unchanged.

Specified by:
configure in interface XMLConfigurable
Overrides:
configure in class FsfwConfigurator
Throws:
XMLWriteConfigurationException - , if the configuration passed on ist not a valid configuration or null

getConfiguration

public org.dom4j.Element getConfiguration()
                                   throws XMLReadConfigurationException
Returns a root node of name "polyglotoptions" with a first level node for each option, whose text specifies the chosen value.

Specified by:
getConfiguration in interface XMLConfigurable
Overrides:
getConfiguration in class FsfwConfigurator
Returns:
The current configuration
Throws:
XMLReadConfigurationException - if isConfigured() == false or the configuration can not be returned for some other reason

isConfigured

public boolean isConfigured()
Returns true

Specified by:
isConfigured in interface XMLConfigurable
Overrides:
isConfigured in class FsfwConfigurator
